alert.note: Alert for Gove; Graham; Logan; Sheridan; Thomas (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 10:14PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Thomas, northeastern Logan, southern Sheridan, southern Graham and northern Gove Counties through 1045 PM CDT... At 1014 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles west of Oakley to 3 miles south of Collyer to 4 miles south of Ellis. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Thomas, northeastern Logan, southern Sheridan, southern Graham and northern Gove Counties, including the following locations... Saint Peter and Angelus. This includes Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 69 and 113. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Goodland.
